form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Flake (for himself and Ms. Ayotte) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To permit health insurance issuers to offer additional plan options to individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Removing Limitations on Insurance Effectiveness and Flexibility Act of 2015 or the ReLIEF Act.

section.header: Authority to offer additional plan options

subsection.text: Notwithstanding title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (Public Law 111â€“148), a catastrophic plan as described in section 1302(e) of such Act shall be deemed to be a qualified health plan (including for purposes of receiving tax credits under section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and cost-sharing assistance under section 1402 of this Act), except that for purposes of enrollment in such plans, the provisions of paragraph (2) of such section 1302(e) shall not apply.
Coverage under a catastrophic plan under subsection (a) shall be deemed to be minimum essential coverage for purposes of section 5000A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
